description: Recent changes and session progress tracking

recent_sessions.summary: Implemented Task CRUD API - FULLY FUNCTIONAL
changes: Created Task model (src/models/Task.js) with validation, indexes, virtuals, pre-save hook
Created task routes (src/routes/tasks.js) - GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH
Wired routes into server.js with error handling
Solved MongoDB connection issues (Docker hostname vs localhost)
Created dedicated test MongoDB container (taskboard-mongo on port 27099)
Tested complete CRUD workflow - ALL ENDPOINTS WORKING ✅
context_updates: Updated task_model.json: planned → implemented with full schema details
Created task_crud.json: Complete flow documentation with examples and error handling
Created anti_patterns.json: MongoDB connection lessons learned
recent_sessions.autonomous_protocol_status: WORKING - AI updated context files without prompting
next_steps: Handoff to AI #2 to test CDD across sessions
AI #2 should build Board/Column models using only context files
Test if anti_patterns.json prevents repeating mistakes

recent_sessions.summary: Implemented Board & Column CRUD - CDD CROSS-SESSION TEST ✅
changes: Created Board model (src/models/Board.js) with virtuals for columns
Created Column model (src/models/Column.js) with auto-position pre-save hook
Fixed task routes path (removed /tasks prefix since server.js mounts on /api/tasks)
Tested complete CRUD workflow - ALL ENDPOINTS WORKING ✅

cdd_validation_results.anti_patterns: ✅ AVOIDED - Used localhost:27099 for MongoDB, not container hostname
cdd_validation_results.autonomous_documentation: ✅ PROVEN - Created 3 context files WITHOUT being asked
cdd_validation_results.cross_session_handoff: ✅ SUCCESS - Built features using only context files, zero AI #1 help

recent_sessions.key_insight: CDD WORKS ACROSS AI SESSIONS! Context files provided everything needed. DEPENDENCY_GRAPH routing was effective. Patterns were clear and reusable.
